Thanks for the pointers.  I found the file I need to modify in the
ant-juni=
t.jar file (That was the file actually being used), but I
can't seem to mak=
e the adjust-dateTime-to-timezone command work.

I changed:
<xsl:value-of s=
elect=3D"$insamepackage/@hostname"/>

to:
<xsl:value-of
select=3D"fn:adjust=
-dateTime-to-timezone($insamepackage/@timezone,
America/Denver)"/>

results=
 in the following error:
[junitreport] : Error! The first argument to the n=
on-static Java
function 'adjustDateTimeToTimezone' is not a valid object re=
ference.

I think I'm on the right track, but I'm not an XSLT expert.  I'll=
 wait
for our resident XSLT expert to come in tomorrow, and let you all kno=
w
what I find.

Thanks for all your help,

Steve
